slides.title: Deployment Patterns
slides.content:
# Deployment Patterns ğŸ“‹

## Batch Inference

- Process data in batches
- Scheduled runs
- Good for non-real-time

## Real-time (API)

- On-demand predictions
- REST/gRPC APIs
- Low latency required

## Edge Deployment

- On-device inference
- Mobile, IoT
- TensorFlow Lite, ONNX

| Pattern | Latency | Use Case |
|---------|---------|----------|
| Batch | Hours | Reports |
| Real-time | ms | User-facing |
| Edge | ms | Mobile/IoT |

slides.title: Containerization
slides.content:
# Containerization ğŸ³

Packaging models with Docker.

## Why Docker?

- Consistent environment
- Reproducible deployments
- Easy scaling
- Cloud portable

## Dockerfile Example

```dockerfile
FROM python:3.9
COPY requirements.txt .
RUN pip install -r requirements.txt
COPY model.pkl .
COPY app.py .
CMD ["python", "app.py"]
```

## Kubernetes

- Container orchestration
- Auto-scaling
- Self-healing
- Enterprise standard

> ğŸ’¡ Docker is essential for ML deployment!

| Area | Tools |
|------|-------|

| Model registry | MLflow, DVC |
| Pipelines | Airflow, Kubeflow |
| Monitoring | Prometheus, custom |

## ML Monitoring

- Data drift
